description: Liverpool was embarrassed in the FA Cup by Wolverhampton Wanderers on Saturday, with a week of misery for Juergen Klopp completed by losing 2-1 to the second-tier side.

title: Benny Feilhaber among US vets getting 2nd chance under Arena
description: Only a year ago, Benny Feilhaber thought he had no chance to get back in the good graces of Jurgen Klinsmann and the U.S. national team.

title: Arsenal manager Wenger banned from touchline for 4 games
description: The English Football Association has banned Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger from the touchline for four matches after an altercation with a match official.

title: Alejandro Bedoya lashes out at Eric Wynalda after USMNT win
description: "This dude has a well documented dislike for me that I don't get."

title: Lionel Messi to have MRI scan, may miss time with Barcelona
description: The superstar aggravated a groin injury playing for Argentina.

title: Late Sanchez penalty gives Arsenal 2-1 win over Burnley

title: Messi scores 5th goal in 6 games as Barcelona beats Eibar

description: Sevilla salvaged a key 4-3 victory in a thrilling game against last-place Osasuna on Sunday, guaranteeing second place at the halfway point of the Spanish league season.

description: Still to clear up the ambiguity over last weekend's absence from the Chelsea team, Diego Costa did his talking on the pitch on Sunday.

title: Southampton inflicts 11th loss of Leicester's title defence
description: Southampton condemned Leicester to the 11th loss of its Premier League title defense with a 3-0 victory on Sunday, leaving the champions five points above the relegation zone.

description: Jurgen Klinsmann is proud of his half-decade in charge of the U.S. national team, and the coach believes he left successor Bruce Arena in a position to make the Americans even better.

title: FIFPro warning to players: don't sign for Serbian clubs
description: The world soccer players' union has warned against signing contracts with Serbian clubs in the forthcoming transfer window, calling the Balkan country "a lawless environment." FIFPro says its 2016 global survey found 68 percent of all players in Serbia have their salaries delayed, and 89 percent of those who moved to their clubs for a fee "were pressured into the transfer." Now, FIFPro says, things are getting even worse.

title: German prosecutors consider whether to probe 2006 World Cup
description: FRANKFURT, Germany (AP) German prosecutors say they are examining whether there are grounds to open an investigation of allegations that German bidders used a slush fund to help secure the 2006 World Cup.

title: Franz Beckenbauer denies claims bribes were paid for 2006 World Cup votes
description: Beckenbauer says he never paid to secure votes for Germany's 2006 World Cup bid.

title: Juventus hold Inter Milan to goalless draw
description: Inter missed chance to reclaim top of Serie a with draw.

title: Red Bulls' Grella scores fastest goal in MLS history
description: Mike Grella scored the first of Red Bulls' four goals in 7 seconds.

title: Referee calls off Cyprus match after fan-player tussle
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus (AP) Officials say a referee has called off a Cypriot first-division match after fans briefly invaded the pitch and clashed with players before the game had started.

title: Arsenal faces tough test vs. Bayern in CL, PSG hosts Madrid
description: BARCELONA, Spain (AP) Arsene Wenger's hopes of Arsenal turning around its floundering Champions League campaign rest on the daunting task of toppling Pep Guardiola's Bayern Munich on Tuesday.

title: MLS Roundup: Red Bulls clinch top spot in East
description: Red Bulls romp over Union; Sounders stumble in Houston.

title: Celta beats Villarreal with late goal to stay top in Spain
description: BARCELONA, Spain (AP) Celta Vigo forward Manuel ''Nolito'' Agudo scored in the 90th minute to snatch a 2-1 win at 10-man Villarreal and pull the visitors level with Real Madrid and Barcelona at the top of the Spanish league on Sunday.

title: Beckenbauer denies claims bribes secured 2006 World Cup
description: BERLIN (AP) Soccer great Franz Beckenbauer says he never paid anyone to secure votes for Germany's 2006 World Cup bid following allegations that bribes were involved.

title: Hannover pull off upset victory against in-form Köln
description: Hannover put halt to Köln's best-ever start in 1-0 upset victory.

title: Marseille held 1-1 by Lorient in French league
description: PARIS (AP) Marseille players were booed off the pitch Sunday after the nine-time champions were held 1-1 by Lorient in the French league.

title: Muller insists United move 'not up for discussion'
description: Thomas Muller insists he is not interested in a move to Manchester United.

title: Lokomotiv wins Moscow derby as Zenit falls further behind
description: MOSCOW (AP) Lokomotiv Moscow underlined its status as a contender for the Russian Premier League title with a 2-1 win over Spartak Moscow on Sunday, while defending champion Zenit St. Petersburg continued to struggle.

title: Celta down Villarreal with late goal, go joint top of La Liga
description: Celta Vigo forward Nolito scored in the 90th minute to snatch a 2-1 win at Villarreal.
